intro: Clarionea pedicularifolia, commonly known as the hanging bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its pendant, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are woody and branched. Clarionea pedicularifolia thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests.
